file_content.text: This is Keeper. You're approaching the station now.
I can monitor you so long as you keep an open channel. We'll be with you through the assault.
I'm preparing to dock. No sign they've noticed me.
Acknowledged.
Imperial Intelligence is gone. Designations are meaningless.
Don't call yourself "Keeper."
I won't--I won't have this discussion now.
Don't you trust me?
I can do this alone.
I want to be there for this.
Your ship is cloaked, but once you're aboard you'll need to move fast. Take out any conspirators quick as you can.
Anyone not there in person, we'll start hunting down as soon as you identify them.
The Minister is waiting for you.
...utilize fractal thought pattern twenty-seven. Reanalyze.
I'm glad you're back. They're reconstructing the conspirators' holoconference now.
It's been a while. How are you holding up?
It's good to see you again.
As well as anyone, under current circumstances.
Come in. They're reconstructing the conspirators' holoconference now.
Anything turn up so far?
What've you found out?
Genetic engineering plays havoc with your people's brains, doesn't it?
Your Watchers are crazy.
If it didn't have an effect, it wouldn't be worth the bother.
The galaxy's at war, and you're sending me on flights of fancy.
This had better be worth it.
You and I both know what this means.
Preliminary analysis bears out our theory: The call was initiated by Hunter somewhere in the Brema Sector six months ago.
The recording you pulled is intact, but--Watcher Nine?
Splicing and decryption complete.
--rules of the Koros Covenant, I call this meeting to order.
Spare us the corporate posture and report.
Since you're in a hurry. Senator Voralla and Representative Shuuru are predictable as always.
And Commenor...?
All taken care of. What about you--those earnest Padawans keeping you up at night?
Different participants on different datastreams. Processing.
There's Hunter. What about the others?
Do you recognize them?
I don't know.
We're getting names, but not a lot of context.
What are they talking about?
Commenor has a military training base, but--they're moving on.
Look at them, safe and secure. They think they rule the world.
You can smell the arrogance.
Who can blame them?
--domain is unsettled, as we expected. I must again raise the concern: Do we overplay our hand?
There is the chance it will spin out of control. Darth Angral, Darth Baras, now the Children are awakening.
For each, there is a Republic counterbalance.
We're letting loose the reins, but we're not taking off their blinders. Sit back and enjoy the spectacle.
However much power they've got, they see their plan as a risk.
They know they're vulnerable.
Don't tell me we're missing whole sections.
Can't this thing work?
[Remain silent]
--to bicker. Each of us agreed to the timetable. Each of us reports success in our own sphere.
Ambition must never be our master. Patience serves our noble cause best. But if our enforcer approves....
I do. I swear.
...then we move forward, to Armageddon.
Keeper? The war council needs you.
Sir?
Ah!
Talk to me, Keeper. Look at me!
What's happening?
We need security and a medical team!
Call for a medic. Go!
Get help, now!
Yes, sir!
We have a breach. No one leaves, understood?
Lock down headquarters.
Yes, sir. Security and medical help is on the way.
What's our status?
Keeper and the others are on life support. Fixers theorize the transmission had a hidden overlay.
A code or image only a genetically enhanced mind could recognize, designed to overwhelm and shut down the brain.
They knew it would take an enhanced mind to find the data. This was insurance against that possibility.
The recording was trapped.
You said they're on life support. Any prognosis?
Will they be okay?
Without understanding the trigger? They could be vegetables for hours or for decades.
So being born ordinary has its advantages.
Score one for natural people.
It does ensure a certain robustness.
Losing this many analysts--forget about Keeper--it's going to be a blow to the war.
I'll support you where I can, but right now I've got a few dozen field agents without handlers. Your operation....
Take care of your people, Watcher Three. I'll proceed on my own.
The war is your top priority.
The people responsible for this should be our top priority.
Our operation is vital!
I speak with the authority of the Sith. My operation is theirs.
You would defy Jadus's Hand?
You'll hear from me when I'm ready.
I prefer working alone anyway.
While you were on Belsavis, Keeper was compiling leads on the planet Voss. If you want to head there, I'll see what I can pull up.
I know you and Keeper were close, sir. I'll make sure you receive updates on her condition.
I've apprised the Minister of Intelligence--Darth Jadus, too, but he's still in seclusion. That's all I can do.
I've apprised the Minister of Intelligence--if he needs to contact you, he knows how.
Come on. If someone's gonna take out your co-workers, it should be us--not some cocky shadow pansies.
We still have a lead. We'll find the people responsible.
I didn't know them well, but... I'm sorry, sir. We'll hunt down the people who did this.
Hard not to admire their security. I'd very much like to meet these people.
I'm disappointed they didn't share that trap with me on Belsavis. I would be interested in developing it further.
Operative Djannis? Would you mind?
Mind? I wouldn't stay if you paid me.
Master Hyllus, could we have a moment?
Of course, Keeper.
Fixer, would you mind waiting elsewhere?
I have some catching up to do in the city.
Ensign... Temple? Would you mind sweeping the Cipher's ship?
I can get right on that.
Hello, Cipher. Thank you for coming.
You know, I don't often drink--the headaches and nosebleeds are part of the price of my heritage.
Keeper... tell me what we're doing.
Why are we here?
Are you uncomfortable? Can I help you relax?
[Flirt] You look nervous...
In a manner of speaking.
And I thought you were genetically superior in every way.
I'm losing respect for you.
Most ways, not all. The new generation is an improvement.
Quite a while ago, when I took this designation, I said we were over and you said I should keep an open mind.
I did, and I thought, and I realized I don't know why you were being so persistent.
I was being persistent because you mean the world to me.
I care deeply about you.
Strange to hear you talk like that.
Why do you need to know my motives to determine how you feel?
Does it really matter?
That's it, though. I know how I feel.
I like you, Cipher. I like that you're an effective agent, I like the way you make my brain fuzz over.
I'm not going to resign as Keeper, and we can't--but I'm willing to hope, and watch for our chance to be together.
I can be patient. You're a woman worth waiting for.
I'd like that.
Officially, I'm a woman worth millions.
Some chances pass by quickly.
What about now? [Kiss her]
They do, at that.
They'll be expecting me in the Citadel. Please be careful on this mission--I can't predict what's ahead.
Things are dangerous for all of us. Take care of yourself, and rest when you can.
Let's both be careful.
If I rest, who'll keep the new Watchers in line?
I swear to you, you won't regret choosing to try.
We'll make this work someday.
That's not your promise to make.
I fought Darth Jadus and I fought a Jedi. Whoever these people are, they don't know who they're up against.
This enemy doesn't scare me.
Neither do you. Remember that.
Get to your ship, and we'll have the future when it comes.
Don't ask me to put my life on hold again.
I can't keep waiting for you.
I understand, of course.
I was being persistent for my own reasons. To be frank, they no longer apply.
I've moved on since then.
I suspected as much, but I had to be sure.
Consider this our last calm together, then. The next few months will be busy, and none of us is too valuable to be spared.
When one of us dies... the other can remember a better moment.
Cipher, don't say anything. I'm walking out of the Citadel, and I'd like to discuss the... personal matters you've brought up before.
Can we meet in the Nexus Room? For a drink?
You're exhausted and we're in crisis mode. Are you sure?
Is this the right time?
You're leaving the planet, and I'm back on duty in an hour. I'm very sure.
I've been waiting to hear you say that for ages.
[Flirt] Of course.
I'm aware of that.
Five minutes, alone, please.
I think it's time to put personal matters aside. Don't you?
We should focus on work.
Yes, of course. Thank you for the course correction.
I'll talk to you at the target site.
You'll have to excuse me.
Your assistance is appreciated.
